result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristina M. Case was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: 2 years probation, conditions of probation 30 days county jail with huber report  10-10-14   by 3pm,   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  Absolute Sobriety,  No drug use without a valid prescription. DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00, and fine of $656.00  Report to probation today.

miscConds.notes: $656.00  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$250.00  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.
Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations, by 10-10-14

Defendant Cristina M. Case in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cristina M. Case in court with Attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Dan Glaze sworn/testifies direct.  Defense declines questioning witness.  All parties rest.  Court gives 20 days extension in deadlines for filing trial documents.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of Complaint.  D pleads/court enters a not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cristina M. Case in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Duffy just met with client today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Cristina M. Case in court with attorney TJ Duffy for Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waives time limits for preliminary. Bond continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cristina M. Case in court.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
